comments:
Clicking the preview tab in the report designer editor, produces an error dialog: "internal error, An SWT Error has ocurred...See .log for more details... Do you want to exit the workbench? [Yes] [No]".

I use Eclipse 3.2R6, JDK 1.5 on Suse Linux 10.1.

The MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set is probably not the problem because mozilla work in other parts of eclipse, and the toolbar button View report as HTML works.
Anyway I tried to work around by doing export MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=/usr/bin/firefox before starting eclipse, but got the following error instead:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles (java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /home/dag/program/eclipse3.2RC6/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/44/1/.cp/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3232.so: libxpcom.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3400)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3297)
	at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:166)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.preview.editors.ReportPreviewEditor.createPartControl(ReportPreviewEditor.java:149)
Which BIRT build you are using? Can you launch "help" of Eclipse?

Looks the native library libswt-mozilla-gtk-3232.so can not find.
This more likes enviroment problem.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Which BIRT build you are using? Can you launch "help" of Eclipse?
> 

I use 2.1.0.N20060531-1258.
Eclipse Help works properly. And also the BIRT toolbar button "View report as HTML".

Could you please check if /home/dag/program/eclipse3.2RC6/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/44/1/.cp/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3232.so is in the right location?
We can't reporduce this issue.
By review the code, this error happened when we try to new a Browser class in preview page.
The Browser class uses the system native library to populate a browser instance. This error happened when the native code try to access the library file.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Could you please check if
> /home/dag/program/eclipse3.2RC6/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/44/1/.cp/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3232.so

> instance. This error happened when the native code try to access the library
> file.
> 
The file libswt-mozilla-gtk-3232.so is in the place above and, the View report as HTML works and it uses the same Browser class that crashes in the Preview operation.
I tried to find some more info by launching an Eclipse application with the debug launcher.
Now Even the View report as HTML crashes. But I get a logging in the main eclipse console:

the report file that causes the error. It is created acording to the birt tutorial.
By read the lastest comments from report, looks more like the birt viwer deployed error. There're xml parser errors when GUI try to start the web viewer.
Try the latest build. I can preview it well.
